website_summaries.verdict: This robust chainsaw can use an ion battery from any other of the B+D 20-volt line of tools, reducing the model’s overall cost.
pros: Users with other pieces in the 20-volt series love the ability to interchange the battery into multiple tools
Chain tension is easy to set
Saw is easy to clean when it’s messy
Light enough to use while on a ladder
Perfect for clearing out smaller branches
cons: Does not come with a battery or charger
Will not have as much power as a large gas chainsaw

customer_reviews.title: Oiler Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly good saw. I bought it to augment my gas Jonsered and 110v Remington saws. It's great for taking into the woods behind the house to take down saplings. I use it with a 4Ah battery, so it has plenty of run time. However, as has been mentioned many times in these reviews, the oiler on mine doesn't work. Also, the chain seems to have taken a bite out of the plastic housing at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schneider

customer_reviews.title: No power, bar lubrication didn't work
customer_reviews.text: No power, can't do much more than a toy. Manual oil feed didn't work which makes this useless. Without chain lubrication the chain and bar can't perform. The chain oil leaks out of the oil reservoir when saw is not upright as the cap has a hole in it. Frustrating since the bar oil goes everywhere except to bar and chain where it is suppose to go. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: DKLA

customer_reviews.title: FAULTY OILER TWICE
customer_reviews.text: Oiler did not work, got a replacement and the replacement oiler did not work. Called Black and Decker and they said Amazon must have gotten a bad batch. Test the manual oiler Immediately after opening. Seems to be a current issue, see other current amazon reviews with the same complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Jus10

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw, oiler did not work.
customer_reviews.text: A goods saw, except the oiler did not work, which downgrades it to one star. Chain speed was slow, but acceptable. Very lightweight!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended for the homeowner
customer_reviews.text: You won’t be felling any giant redwoods with this but it is good for trees about 12” in diameter or smaller. I like that the chain installation/tensioning is completely tool free. It’s powerful enough and I don’t miss the exhaust and fueling and starting hassles of an internal combustion engine at all. Tip: Keep the chain lubricated!! i use cheap vegetable oil. Inexpensive, does the job, and is good for the environment. Tip: There are well made Li-Ion batteries available online for less than half the manufactures price with higher capacity (Amp hours). They do the job just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Professor Awesome

customer_reviews.title: Amazing machine!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I received it I opened the box and got busy! I have other B&D tools that use the same 20V battery so I was ready to go. With some basic instructions on how to use and safety precautions from my neighbor, I got to work. This chainsaw is a woman's dream! I no longer need to wait on anyone else to cut up fallen branches or cutting trees. Even with the 100 year old cedar branches, this chainsaw was able to cut through them. After two hours of trimming and cutting, I was wore out but the battery on the chainsaw was still ready to go. I highly recommend this chainsaw for the novice and women.
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

customer_reviews.title: Great for women
customer_reviews.text: I often had to wait for my husband to get before trimming up problem trees in our yard. We have just under 8 acres and there are a lot of trees to trim! With this lightweight portable unit I can do the trimming myself without hesitation. I took away a star because it is not really appropriate for very large limbs and because the chain oil is manual. I feel like this should be standard vs a premium feature because it is so important (have forgotten once Mid-job and the chain began to overheat). Overall it meets my needs extremely well and so far the largest wood cut with it was a 4in diameter round post.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy mom

customer_reviews.title: JUST WHAT A GEEZER NEEDS
customer_reviews.text: Shipped well packed, as always, from Amazon. Saw is Chinese as expected. Cuts limbs and small logs with no issues. Battery life is just OK ... but it lasts about as long as I need it to last. I just go and pee or take a nap -- or both -- while it charges back up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Greener

customer_reviews.title: Fully charge battery doesn't last longer than an hour.
customer_reviews.text: Not useful for normal workloads. This chainsaw will definitely cut through wood and has the power to make decently large cuts. The problem is that with a full charged battery this thing will not last more than about an hour of light work and half hour of heavy work. I'm currently looking into extended charge batteries that are compatible. Otherwise, I will probably end up returning it for a refund and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to do some tree pruning (branches from about 1 to 6 inches). I ordered without a battery since i have several from other tools and the saw came completely assembled in the box. I just added oil and fired it up. I was really worried about battery life as all of mine are just 1.5 ah but I worked in the yard most of the day and filled a dumpster with branches and only swapped the battery once. This is VERY light weight, very easy to use, and cuts just fine. I am very pleased with this purchase and it is a nice addition to my B&D collection.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart N. Grant

customer_reviews.title: A perfect addition to my tools
customer_reviews.text: My daughter gave me this chainsaw for mothers day because she knew I was thinking about buying one. I'm very handy and will jump in to do projects myself but needed a smaller chainsaw that I could use. The first time using it, I managed to get about 45 minutes out of the battery. I was cutting down and trimming trees on my property. The chainsaw is amazing. Very lightweight but durable. I love how the battery is the same as other tools I have so I can use them interchangeably. I recommend this chainsaw and all their other products to anyone looking for reliability and durability. Ive never been disappointed in their products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: I really like this thing. Got it to use by the fire pit to cut branches and small logs to fit as needed while the fire is going. cut some logs that were 4-5" diameter just fine, smaller 1-2" branches quick and easy. Used one of the fat 6Ah batteries while burning brush for several hours. went through a couple of big piles of branches and several small logs w/o every changing out the battery. i have gas chain saws, but this thing is great, push the button and cut w/o the loud noise.
customer_reviews.author: cutshot76

customer_reviews.title: My New Love
customer_reviews.text: Is it possible to fall in love with a chain saw? The lightweight feel for it and the handle are great for small hands. It cut through a 7" hardwood tree trunk like butter. I had a tree growing out of a basement window well and I could remove the tree with no problems due to the manuverability and lightweight features of this chainsaw. I especially appreciate power tools that are lightweight. Not everyone doing yard work lifts 100lbs on a daily basis and that should not be a requirement to use powertools.
customer_reviews.author: RO

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many glowing reviews I broke down and ordered this saw. I was quite disappointed when I used it to try and cut up a tree that was blown over by the wind. While it would probably be fine for large limbs and small trees, anything with a trunk over 5 or 6 inches is going to be very slow. I understand the appeal of being able to push a button and the saw runs, but I expect it will be years before battery power will compete with gasoline. I would return it if I thought they'd accept it with an oiler full of oil and a saw cover in wood chips.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed for trimming branches and cutting them up. I recently used it to trim a bunch of dead branches from some pine trees. It cut through them very easily. I also cut up some old 2x4's to use for kindling and it cut right through them too. The battery has lasted way longer than I expected. I love how easily it starts compared to my big gas powered chainsaw and of course it is much lighter. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: pegasus9000

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is relatively short--good for light use
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly and intact. Charging takes more than a few hours. I bought this so I would have a lightweight small saw that, if needed, my wife could use. I have two gas saws (Stihl and cheap on-sale Poulan) along with a Harbor Freight battery pole saw so I did not expect this to be my go-to for all usage. It is light and cuts well but only for about an hour at best. I have used it for some 10" downed logs so it can do that. Don't plan on cutting a cord but it is sufficient for light use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money but this saw runs too slow, so it bounces around when it cuts branches on trees. Better than a hand saw, just wish it cut smoother .
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: At first I was undecided between the 20w and 40w version of these cordless chainsaws. Since I had about 6 other 20v B&D batteries from the other cordless tools, the 20w made more sense since it's easy to swap these batteries out when the juice is gone. Home run! The small, sharp 10" blade is perfect for us and made short work of cutting firewood and taking medium sized trees down. I've used it twice and probably worked about 20 minutes each time and never had to swap batteries although I had one in my pocket just in case. Verdict: the B&D cordless 20v chainsaw is an outstanding tool for home use.
customer_reviews.author: A. Reith

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great performance on a budget
customer_reviews.text: So far...WOW! In typical guy fashion I couldn’t wait. Charged the battery for 20 minutes and out I went. Cut 4 branches off a dead tree that were 1-2” diameter, then the trunk that was about 6-7” diameter. Then cut up a 5” branch that broke off another tree. Made approximately 20 cuts before the battery died. Cuts smooth, more power than I expected. Very light weight. So far very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have splurged a little more.
customer_reviews.text: The primer on mine i thought was faulty and wasn't necessarily the case. You just have to keep the oil resorvoir completely full, and sometimes pop back up the bubble. As far as cutting time is concerned, I thought it would be a lot longer. I had enough time in one battery for doing a 2.5 9 inch cuts on one battery. I even have a second battery and could only cut for around 10 minutes each battery. There is no chain safety cut off. In wish I would have just splurged a little bit more for a gas powered one. It does do its job of cutting though, so it deserves two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Cole S.

customer_reviews.title: Saw is OK - OILER DOES NOT WORK.
customer_reviews.text: The chain OILER DOES NOT WORK. I took the saw apart with the hope of an easy fix. The oil supply bottle has a two section line from bottle to saw blade. Between the two sections is a filter piece that completely blocks oil flow. I removed this piece and tried running running the line without it. This did not work, - oil ran too quickly. Oil supply bottle emptied itself overnight. I'm keeping the saw and using an oil can to manually apply bar oil during use.
customer_reviews.author: Ed H

customer_reviews.title: Power not strong enough for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item because it was too small and not strong enough for the job that I needed it for. Be careful if you have to return this item. I purchased on my Prime account yet when I returned it Amazon put the return on a gift card which I did not authorize and was not notified that this was done until after I used the gift card. I thought this gift card was an anonymous gift from a friend; which has happened before.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! We cut large limbs from 4 trees in our yard. This saw did WAY more than we ever thought it would! We purchased an extra battery and already had another, so with the three batteries we could work for an afternoon nearly nonstop. Great, safe, and quality product!!! My dad was so impressed with this saw, he even brought it along on a 4-wheel camping trip with a group of men, and all of the guys were VERY impressed with the power and ability of this little cordless electric chain saw. If you can impress that group of guys, you know it is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: N. Saint-Albord

customer_reviews.title: Batteries interchangeable with other outdoor tools of the same brand.
customer_reviews.text: I have a gas powered chainsaw. I bought this for light trimming and small tree removal because I have about 35 trees on my lot. I have only used it once. However I was surprised at the torque of the electric motor. And, the battery lasted longer than my use that time. As to the battery, it is the same size and has the same connections as the other same brand tools I have. Therefore, I can use interchangeably between my trimmer and this saw. Overall, this is perfect for my intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Beeghley

customer_reviews.title: Rare to find something that works better than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Try standing atop a 6ft ladder to prune limbs with a regular gasoline chainsaw, you’ll surrender within minutes from your arms turning to rubber. I was doubtful a battery saw whould work but desperate for a solution. I couldn’t be happier, see the attached photo to see that I filled my trailer twice with only two full batteries. The other reviews talk about the saw bouncing but I found putting the base of the chain bar against the limb let’s the saw do the work with no need for me to push it down. I seriously did most of the cutting with one hand while using the other to steady myself on the ladder. I highly recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: ashmoreg

customer_reviews.title: Good Experiences With This Chainsaw - Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This battery powered chainsaw has proved to be quite handy to have around the house/yard. I've had it now for about seven months. I have had several occasions where I've needed to trim off dead tree branches, and this chainsaw was up to the task. I wouldn't recommend this for heavy duty tree or log cutting jobs. But for quick and easier jobs around the yard, it's perfect. I have not had the battery run out of energy while I've been using it. My guess is that I've had the saw running about 25 minutes over a period of an hour... and it still had energy left in the battery.
customer_reviews.author: AZ-Retired

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to, well
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite impressed with this little chainsaw. I cleared about 5500 square feet of my property, which was full of mostly small maple trees and saplings (2"-8"), and it didn't have any trouble. The battery life would be my only complaint, but for the price it really shouldn't be a surprise. I would get about 20 minutes of hard usage cutting maple hardwood before it would run out of juice. Casual cutting, or cutting softer wood like pine, it would last twice that. If you have a bigger job to do I wouldn't suggest this one, but for home owners with light tasks it's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: S. B.

customer_reviews.title: Fine Little Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is an adequate little saw for small clean up projects. It's not a workhorse by any means, and is not what you want for your big woodcutting jobs, but for smaller limbs and trimming it has worked well. It does not seem fussy to get it prepared or keep it running. I have other tools that use the same battery, which is the way to go. I cut up a downed sycamore limb up to about 10 inches in diameter quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: TJW417

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.  A little light Weight & Leaks
customer_reviews.text: This saw is weak compared to a normal gas saw but that is to be expected. A little lighter duty than I thought it would be - but does my job. The part that is very disappointing is that the "Manual Oiler" for the chain bar leaks from the pump top in use when inverted and also - BIG ALSO - it leaks continuously from the pump reservoir down through the outlet and the base of the bar to the shelf where stored. Can't even store it on its side because then the pump rubber dome leaks. I now have to store it in a drip pan... So it goes now with my grease guns, Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: mogbill

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but get an aftermarket 7.0Ah battery
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this and don't know if I'll ever use a gas powered chainsaw again. It's quiet, lightweight, powerful and gets through most smaller trees with no problem. The one thing you MUST get is a high capacity battery. Those basic 20v batteries that come with B&D tools won't last more than 10 minutes. Get yourself a couple of the 20V 7.0Ah batteries and you can run for 30 minutes. I also recommend the fast charger. There are aftermarket products for both of these items and they work very well and don't cost nearly as much.
customer_reviews.author: 5MIN2GG

customer_reviews.title: Laughable battery life
customer_reviews.text: Moderately effective for a battery-powered unit, but on a single charge it can only last around 10 minutes or less for serious cutting. (I’m using it to clear away deadwood around the house and remediate for fire safety.) Sort of a silly waste of time, once you get the earmuffs and goggles and gloves and other protective gear on, and set the intention to go out and get some work done, and then have to stop almost immediately. Good safety features, though, good looking and easy to handle. This might be a five-star review if the battery was worth a toss.
customer_reviews.author: Satchitananda

customer_reviews.title: High quality tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw! Just charge the battery and cut like crazy!! I cut a 14 year old plum tree I had planted too close to our house . Our son helped since I'm a stroke survivor and only have the use of my right hand. No problem cutting vertically. Horizontal cuts are a bit of a challenge though. I give this saw a 5 star rating in all categories.
customer_reviews.author: mpmgr

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! After I assembled it properly.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the chain saw. I own a few other Black and Decker yard tools (pole saw, and hedge trimmer) that I found work really well. I got this and tried it a few times and it did not work at all. It came with the chain already installed. After inspecting it I realized the chain was backwards. I Switched that around and now it works great. Battery lasted much longer then I tough it would also. Over all it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had nothing but fun with this saw! With only a 10” bar I wondered if I’d be able to do what I bought it for. Yes! I have been trimming trees. I’ve been cutting down dead trees. The battery life is perfect as my arms are getting tired by the time the charge is wearing down, although I’m considering buying a second battery, just in case. Next I’ll tackle my husbands abandoned telephone pole, also known as The Leaning Tower of Wind-toys, long deceased. The best part is it’s mine! I purchased because the hubby wouldn’t do the work. Now he wants to play with it, but it’s mine, lol!
customer_reviews.author: Llinda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: First off, you are not buying a Stihl or Husqvarna, please remember that. I needed something small for brush, trimming trees, cleaning up after storms, etc., and did not need a $400+ gas chain saw. I have family when that need arises. I have multiple Black & Decker 20V outdoor tools, so I added this to the collection since I have a stack of existing batteries. This tool exceeded what I ever expected it to do. I was able to even do cuts through 16" chunks with ease. Expect about 15 minutes of run on a 1.5 AH battery and a little over 20 minutes on a 2.0 AH.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G.

customer_reviews.title: Worth a Shot, Especially if you have other B&D 20V tools
customer_reviews.text: Met my expectations, especially for a 20V. It handles well, just let it do it’s thing. It has a sweet spot, and it’ll gnaw through at a convenient pace. The picture shows logs that are about 7-9 inches in diameter. I wanted to see what it could do. This was about 15 minutes of cuts, I did change the battery once. The battery life is variable, depending on whether you continuously run the chainsaw or not. I used it over the weekend camping and it helped me cut up enough wood to burn. It does really well on 3-5 inch cuts. I hope it stands up to the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: MPWintermute

customer_reviews.title: great chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: What a surprise. This little saw is a work horse. Once I fell a tree I use this saw to remove limbs. It is much easier to walk around a felled tree with a battery operated saw rather than a running gas chainsaw that has the potential to hurt you if you fall. Unfortunately one of the 4.5mAh batteries failed and I can not get it replaced. $73.00 for two batteries, In my case $73.00 for one working battery. But the chain saw is worth the cost and saves my back as it is much lighter rhan my gas chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Muscarella

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a surprising little saw. I'm well aware I'll never be lumberjackin' with this thing, but for occasional light use, it's amazing. It's cut right through everything I've put in front of it, including a few hardwoods. I'm planning to use it to build a little cabin or perhaps a treehouse out in the woods here soon, and am absolutely confident it'll handle the job. It's also quite handy that it uses the standard Black & Decker 20v battery, as I have several lying around for other tools.
customer_reviews.author: J-Fizzle

customer_reviews.title: Better performance than I'd hoped for......
customer_reviews.text: I've been accumulating B&D 20v tools and so far I've loved them all. Weedeater, sawzall, hedgetrimmer and now chainsaw....and wow, I'm impressed with what this chainsaw can do. Only worked with it for 1/2 hour or so, but it's handled everything I've thrown at it so far with no problems. I'm sure the new, sharp blade helps alot, but at 9.00 for a replacement when this one gets dull I'll just chuck it and put on a new one. So far so good, if I see any problems down the road I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: ed baumgarten

customer_reviews.title: Great medium duty chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I got this tool only chain saw because I occasionally like to have small bonfire/fire pit nights and this just made a lot of sense. Recently a friend asked for my help to cut down some smallish (8" caliper) trees. I was able to get through 2 of the trees and some minor cuts with 2 batteries. The trees themselves were pretty dense so that ate up the 1.5Ah batteries I had in no time but I was still impressed. I would recommend this chainsaw for anyone how has a small cutting project and doesn't need a commercial grade piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe in Nash

customer_reviews.title: Mini powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: Little powerhouse! Felled, limbed, and bucked two 10” DBH ashes and a bunch of other trees. You can limb a good bit on the 2mAh batteries (20-30) mins of work. For constant cutting a big log you’re lucky to get ten mins of good power. Let the saw do the work, it’ll bog down easily and cut off. Sharp and handy. Won’t replace a gas saw but a great household saw. Pump Oiler is a joke so be sure to lightly lube your chain manually at battery changes for good measure
customer_reviews.author: Minimalist Guy

customer_reviews.title: OILER DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: I like the saw but like many, many other reviewers before the oiler doesn't work. there should be some type of fix for this considering how long this problem has existed. probably will return
customer_reviews.author: chief2ears

customer_reviews.title: Chain won't stay on.
customer_reviews.text: I really had a lot of hope for this little chainsaw. I had to return the first one I bought because the chain oiler didn't work, but I got another one elsewhere, thinking I could deal with manually oiling it. Which I probably could if the chain didn't fall off every time I try to cut with it. It is a fairly powerful little thing and when the chain is on, I am pretty impressed with how it grinds though the branches, but the chain just flies off at the drop of a hat. So I might as well run my Stihl as put up with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: CMD

customer_reviews.title: works for me
customer_reviews.text: Update! After a bit over a month is dead. Can't return but I'm still ok with it, was cheaper than renting one for a month I guess. Original review: Clearly you are not going to be a lumberjack with this, and like the others the oil did not work so had to oil by hand.... but I was expecting that so no star off for that. Had it so far for 2 days and cut like 5 small trees and a bunch of kudzu vines. If you need it for some small projects its worth it, if you are looking for a career of cutting down trees this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: CLB

customer_reviews.title: Bar/Chain Oil Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Great little trim saw. Too bad the bar/chain oil leaks out the bottom of the two-piece plastic case (after the 1st use). This happened on my Stihl chainsaw, but not until after 25 years. Come on Black and Decker! Geez!. I guess I'll see if their warranty in any good. I'll keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: maggiedear

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time before I would buy or use a chain saw. Have many in shed that my husband had and used that are gas powered. When I lost him I would not use them. Took me 7 years to purchase this one and I love it. I'm an 80 year old female with three acres to maintain. Love working on the property and this saw is just right for me. No cord to pull. I could use one that was a little longer blade, but so far no luck. I would recommend this and would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Decker

customer_reviews.title: Not always as advertised
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this the ad said the battery and charger was in encluded but when it came there was no charger nor battery so I returned it spoke to customer service about it and they said they will send me a new one but with the charger and battery which came in a few days and guess what NO battery nor charger,which I ended up buying from EBay,but the chain saw is great,Amazon has become less then the great place to shop that it was.
customer_reviews.author: niteliter

customer_reviews.title: Love this lil machine
customer_reviews.text: Tired of yanking on dang rope and having ditched another electric saw...I decided to give the cordless a try. Surprised! This little 10 inch saw does all I want. It will cut the bar length no problem. It is light and only sound is chain at work. Some said chain oiler doesn't work...but mine seemed ok. I wouldn't attempt taking on larger heavier jobs.....but works fine around yard on small trees and tough shrubs. If you got an extra bat or two...you can do a lot. I recommend to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: JW Smith

customer_reviews.title: This is a great saw for jobs where you don't want to fire up the Stihl 028.
customer_reviews.text: I trimmed all of the branches of a 25' pine tree before I brought it down. It's very lightweight, cuts quickly and was able to trim all the branches plus the top third of the trunk with one battery. Incredible. It didn't use as much chain saw oil as I though it would and the need to self-lubricate the chain was easy. I'm glad I bought this plus it uses the same battery as my hedge trimmer and rose sprayer. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: D Carls

customer_reviews.title: Prune some 4" or less limbs and your good. I strongly recommend the 4ah battery as the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest. If you use it for what it is then it's a 4-5 star. But let's be honest. It's an electric saw. What do I mean? It is a light duty saw that could trim some branches but that's about it. Yes you probably can fell a 12" tree with lots of patience but it's not what it's made for. Prune some 4" or less limbs and your good. I strongly recommend the 4ah battery as the stock one runs out of power in 10 minutes of use. Beyond that gas power. My experience? Have a 120 acre Wood lot own a number of different saws from $800 to $99
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend
customer_reviews.text: Been a while since I was a chain saw guy. Needed to clear some brush so my tennis court could get sun. Firstly I cannot put anything together. This was simple. I did however go to the hardware store to be certain. They gladly made a few small adjustments. The lithium battery is awesome and plugs right into the chain saw. It's sturdy and powerful. After about fifteen minutes of good work the battery starts to give out. You will know. Hopefully your not in the middle of a california sequoia when this occurs. I am pleased as a peach and love love love this product.
customer_reviews.author: reademandweep

customer_reviews.title: FULLY ASSEMBLED, YES!
customer_reviews.text: I like that this saw came already fully so all I needed to do was put oil in the oil reservoir, prime it a couple of times and put it to work. I ordered the saw alone because I have other 20V B/D products that use the same battery and did not need another one. The saw is very easy to operate, light weight and powerful. My first project was cutting down a small dead Japanese Maple tree, and this saw was up for that task.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonjunkie

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is good. It outlasted me. I was a bit concerned about the battery life but I was tired before it was. It works well. I had a lot of brush to clear. It was more than I wanted to tackle with the bow saw but I didn't want to get out the huge chainsaw. This is perfect. It does a good job. It is lightweight and easy to use. Don't let the weight and size fool you. It is not a toy. The largest I have cut so far is about 6 inches diameter. This saw had no problem with that.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Duty Saw
customer_reviews.text: We picked this up for light duty work without the noise and mess of a gas-powered saw. I have been pleasantly surprised how well it works. It has taken down small trees and is great at trimming branches and cutting up trees into smaller sizes as long as you do not try to force it. Compared to a gas-powered machine, it is nearly silent. The batteries it runs on are useful for the weed trimmer and drill we also own. Pick up a couple of extra batteries and you can go almost all day.
customer_reviews.author: Fairlawn16

customer_reviews.title: Serious problem!! But resolved.
customer_reviews.text: The "bar adjust locking knob" won't move. I spent 38 min on phone waiting for Black & Decker support to answer until I hung up. That alone should discourage you from buying this product. Update: I finally got thru and got the help I needed. Also their response was to acknowledge my difficulty and send a gift/second battery as compensation. So, I am satisfied and the saw works well.
customer_reviews.author: Meyer A. Rothberg

customer_reviews.title: A lil beast.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this since May when I ordered it and I have cut up some trees. The only thing I have had to do was change the chain yesterday for the first time since using it which was fairly easy and cheap and now I’m back to cutting again. As a 55 year old woman using this chainsaw it rocks. So light and easy to manage. Lovin it, and the price. Ordered another bigger battery so I have two Thanks K.
customer_reviews.author: kay dobbins

customer_reviews.title: Small beast
customer_reviews.text: For a small chainsaw this thing is a beast. For how small it is it wiped out trees in my yard. As a side note, don’t try and cut small branches with it. Battery life is ok for its size, if you need hours of cutting upgrade but it comes with one that will give you a good amount of cut time. Adjustment wheel for the chain stuck the first time but after that no problems. You cannot beat this for the price and versatility
customer_reviews.author: Nlakat13

customer_reviews.title: Great for little stuff, but oiler doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the little stuff like mountain laurel. I use it for maintaining a hiking trail and carry it in a backpack a mile up the trail. I've cut up to an 8" oak log, and a few larger logs that were very soft wood. My only problem is that the oiler does not work. No oil at all is released no matter how much the primer is pressed I can't find any help on the matter and I don't know if this is a serious problem because it's cutting OK. Maybe the lower power means the oil is not as important?
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent...so Far
customer_reviews.text: Came fully assembled, ready to go. I had 6 of the needed batteries already so got unit without one. For average yard work, should be great. I've cut up some branches around the yard already that I was too lazy to get my gas chain saw out for. Worked fine and fast. If you cut out near the tip, it will tend to bounce some. Try cutting close to the unit if possible. Don't know how long a battery will last, but I have plenty to swap with as needed....about 5 seconds to do. I'm moving away from two cycle with everything I can.
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little chainsaw. I needed to drop around 15 small pine trees in my back yard, but didn't want to buy a big gas chainsaw. I took a chance on this light weight black and decker and realized after the first downed tree that it was worth the investment. It has a decent battery life, a decent chain for ripping through small trees and branches, and is super light and versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Popalocks

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Tool-less adjustment is a nice benefit. I ordered this with the battery, which is cheaper than purchasing the battery separately. Plus, it comes with a slow charger. Don't forget about larger batteries. You will need more, and/or, larger batteries for extended work. I've purchased here on Amazon, and, suggest the '5amp 100Wh LB2X4020-OPE 2Packs SUN POWER 2 pack'. $75 for the two, which is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: MikeBWCA

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for trimming trees while climbing. They Oiler is manual and if you follow the instructions and use bar oil it doesn’t work well. I switched over to new motor oil and now I can actually oil the chain while in the tree and the chainsaw has a completely different sound once oil gets on the train. This is very light and works great for up to about 6 inch limbs and a lot safer than trying to manipulate a gas .
customer_reviews.author: esbm308

customer_reviews.title: handy
customer_reviews.text: this thing really surprised me. I was expecting a tool that my wife might use around flower beds and her flora gardens. I leave it in my utv to keep my trails clear. granted it's not a "power-house" saw, but with just a little bit of patience, this dang thing will cut. handy as a pocket on a shirt. I have cut up to 4" limbs with no problem. once you learn to finesse it, this saw performs very well!
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: It always starts!
customer_reviews.text: Yea, I know it's battery operated. That doesn't detract from the fact it always starts. It works as it says it works. I am seventy four and this little gem makes me feel like sixty five again. Very handy for light and medium light jobs. This is not a casual review. I like everything about this.
customer_reviews.author: ex-truck driver

customer_reviews.title: Can’t wait to use this.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used this yet, but I already love it because it has a switch, is lightweight, and small. I don’t cut firewood anymore and with a bad shoulder cannot pull machines to start them. But, I have dead fruit trees and low limbs that brain me when mowing, and I can’t saw manually, so this will be wonderful. I have Black & Decker tools that are 50 or so years old that still work.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley C. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad little chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: These little chainsaw was able to do some work after hurricane Irma hit over here in Florida. The battery life is obviously not the greatest, but was able to cut tree limbs and small trees with no issue or problem. The only issue I have now with it, is that the battery will overheat pretty quickly after a pretty continuous use. Overall not bad tho for a batter powered chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: My wife is scaring me
customer_reviews.text: A great little machine, battery life is great. i would suggest buying another battery or a fast charger. We bought a blower with the same battery, so she can cut branches till the cows come home.only issue is i have to haul away all she cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Runner Witt

customer_reviews.title: Very Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This saw works as well or better than I expected, since it is a battery operated saw. The convenience factor cannot be properly stated! This is the 7th 20V Lithium B&D tool that we have purchased and like all of them. The Lithium batteries are SO much better than the NiMH batteries we had in some previous yard tools.
customer_reviews.author: Slowdog

customer_reviews.title: Great small portable chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great as it does what you buy it for, the portability of a battery powered tool. The battery life is really surprising as it lasts as long in this saw as it does when you have the Trim Saw attached to a MAX Drill. The only downside I've noticed is that it seems more noisy than my 18" electric chainsaw. A great buy that I will recommend to anyone who asks for a suggestion for a 10" portable chainsaw!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Green

customer_reviews.title: 1 drawback - manual chail oil dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than my gas powered chainsaw, but does the job I need it for: cutting dead branches off a variety of trees around my property. Easily handled by one hand when necessary. My only complaint is that I didn't realize it does not automatically keep the chain lubricated - there is a small thumb pump on top of the chain oil reservoir that you have to manually pump 3 of 4 times to force the thick oil down to the chain. It doesn't use much oil each time, but does seem to keep it lubed enough. If you were making a large cut you would probably have to stop several times to keep the chain oiled.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me - Gene

customer_reviews.title: I used this to prune 5 inch plum tree limbs this weekend.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to prune 5 inch plum tree limbs this weekend. I used it for almost half an hour before it gave out. I cut about 20 thick logs. It works great. I pruned till it ran out, cleaned up my mess, took a break till tomorrow. A few extra batteries and it would probably go all day. It is light, the oiler worked on mine, I used a thin 2 stroke oil. No cleaning, not set up, no mixing, no electric cords. If I didn't need a ladder this would almost be enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Slomchinski

customer_reviews.title: Works great and does what it needs to for a smaller ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great and does what it needs to for a smaller sized chainsaw. pretty good life span for the battery too. If you have a lot of branches of small tress to take down i recommend having a second battery charged and ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Mathias

customer_reviews.title: A good choice as long as your needs are minor
customer_reviews.text: A good choice as long as your needs are minor. Underpowered. Battery lasts about 1 hour on a full charge and takes about 6 hours to charge from empty. Keep that in mind if you have a big job to do. Worked fine trimming up a couple of trees that got knocked down in a storm. I would say max width is about 6 inches. Like many others have mentioned, my oiler did not work at first. But found that the chain housing was just too tight. Once loosened, the oiler seems fine. So fine for smaller jobs. If you have a lot of work, get something gas powered
customer_reviews.author: p thomas

customer_reviews.title: Powerful lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. Compatibility with the battery of the other tools that I already had and then lightweight tool that gets the smaller jobs around the house done. I managed to easily cut larger diameters too like 10”. The attached pic plus a few smaller branches is one 2Ah battery load. Not bad unless you want to saw all day long. I don’t mind the manual oiling system but like others have mentioned it’s not quite clear how much oil actually comes out upon pressing the button... I’ll have to learn more about its functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Markus

customer_reviews.title: No Charger
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw, but when we received it, there was no charger. Luckily, we had a Black and Decker charger from another product and were able to charge the battery. If we had not had the charger from another tool, it would have been returned. I hate rating this saw so low since it really does a nice job, but there is no excuse for not having a charger included in the package.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: ... the way to go for old and lazy people like me. Mo mixing gas and oil
customer_reviews.text: This is the way to go for old and lazy people like me. Light and easy to handle. No mixing gas and oil, no pulling to try to crank, no straining to lift a heavy chainsaw, no extension cords. I got this to trim my Crepe Myrtles. I have 24 and this is the easy way to do it. You do need a spare battery, I have the hedge trimmer and the batteries are interchangeable. I was able to trim about three over grown bushes on one charge. Not for cutting firewood. Update: What I mean is like a truck load, I do light firewood cutting around my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasts a long time. Very easy to operate. Doesn't vibrate and wear your arms out.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I was surprised that it didn't vibrate a lot more given how light it is, but it's easy to handle and doesn't wear your hands and arms out running it. I just used it for the first time, and it did a great job. I cut about a dozen small limbs (1" - 3") off one tree, then cut two large ones (over 5") off another tree. Didn't need to change batteries and it finished the job in less than 15 minutes. I'm very satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jack HTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Came with a defective battery
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Father’s Day gift for my dad. Came with a battery that was dead. When asked to replace the battery they stated that I had to send the whole saw back in. Just went to local home store and bought a battery for $25. The saw is great. I’d buy from somewhere else if interested in this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Dilbert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for women!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a small saw that I could handle on my own. My husbands was to big and heavy. I love this machine! Very light weight and easy to handle. Love that it is battery operated, no gas, no cords. After a very nasty storm this machine cut through everything. When I wasn't using it, my husband was!
customer_reviews.author: Donna J. Schafer

customer_reviews.title: This seems like a common issue
customer_reviews.text: Chain oiler does not work so will have to manually apply oil. This seems like a common issue. Otherwise, the chain does get stuck sometimes in thicker branches. Does not compare in power to a gas powered chainsaw, but works fine for clearing downed trees.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Almost really nice.
customer_reviews.text: If you take it nice and easy and don't expect it to have all the oomph of a full sized gas saw, this will cut through an amazing amount of wood. One huge drawback though is the absolute junk it has for a bar oiler. It's barely functional, and the only way I could make it even marginally adequate was to water down the bar lube about 50/50 with sae30 oil. Even then, the hole in the bar clogs up constantly requiring the bar to be removed and the hole cleaned out quite frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley W.

customer_reviews.title: Farm like a girl
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 5’3” self. Chainsaws with engines are just too heavy for me to try to pull a string and crank. I needed a tool that I didn’t have to crank. This one is perfect. Battery life lasts just long enough for me to complete the tasks that I need to complete. Got about two hours of tree trimming out of one battery. When the battery goes out, that tells me it’s time to rest.
customer_reviews.author: Noni Short

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping and small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these for $60 from Warehouse Deals and I must say it is a great little chainsaw. Makes camp life much easier for sure. The included battery seems to be a bit weak (this may be why it was marked down) but I have a bunch of them from other tools that work fine. Using a 2 amp hour battery I can make over 20 cuts on 8-10" logs. Only downside is the oiler but I just keep pushing the button between cuts and it seems to be ok. It is so nice to just throw it in a bag with some batteries and not worry about fuel leaking everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: We had an ice storm that knocked down a lot of trees, that then needed to be cut up. This did the job. Glad I have extra batteries, though. It lasts longer on the shorter cuts, but I have 12 inch or so trunks down, so the battery doesn't last as long. Just need to be careful of the wood binding on the saw. I am so thankful to have this tool. No gasoline!!! No pulling to start!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: BLACK+DECKER LCS1020 20V Max Lithium Ion Chainsaw, 10-Inch
customer_reviews.text: Amazing what a battery powered saw can do. We have cut 10" logs if you take your time. Smaller logs cut easily. If you put too much pressure on the blade it will overheat and the thermal cutout will stop it for a few seconds. Need to let the saw do the cutting. Nice and quiet. We are able to get a few dozen cuts on 5" logs on one charge. You wouldn't want to use it to cut down a tree, but it's great for cutting firewood in the forest for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I like to cut fallen trees and limbs from the woods in our backyard to use in the fire pit and this is the perfect helper. Lightweight, easy to use and clean. No issues with the oil or battery, but I’m also not using it daily or for big jobs. I have a bunch of BD tools and 20 volt batteries already so I just bring an extra in case it’s needed.
customer_reviews.author: NC_ILM

customer_reviews.title: The chainsaw is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw is easy to use, lite , good for cutting small trees or falling branches. I use to have a gas power chainsaw , but time to get it out, fill with gas and adjusting the blade was time consuming .This saw has an adjustment for the blade ,just click the battery in and your ready to go. If you cut a lot of wood ,this is not the saw for you .If your worried about battery life , I have use it for over 20 minutes at a time and still had plenty of power
customer_reviews.author: john plate

customer_reviews.title: So Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am so very impressed with this saw (and 2 other battery powered Black & Decker tools) My wife told me that a battery powered chain saw would be a waste of money. Now she borrows it all the time. It seems never to run out of juice. It is very sturdily built. I have used it to cut trees and branches much thicker than would appear to be prudent, and it has never failed to quickly and cleanly cut through them. I highly recommend this tool as well as the B&D weed wacker and hedge trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: moodiblues

customer_reviews.title: When fully charged, the OEM battery lasts about 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: The OEM battery charger takes about an hour to charge a battery. I purchased the FLAGPOWER 20Volt Li-Ion Battery Charger LCS1620 for Black+Decker 16V 20V Lithium Ion Battery LBXR20 LBXR20-OPE LB20 LBX20 LBX4020 LB2X4020 LBXR2020-OPE BL1514 LBXR16, and charge time is now about 15 min.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dan

customer_reviews.title: All around great chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is the perfect starter chainsaw for first time or novice users. I am a little scared to use a gas powered chainsaw and I have other B & D 20 Volt items so I knew the quality that I would be getting. I use this to clean up small scrub trees and limbs. I feel safe using it. I would recommend a spare battery if you plan on doing a lot of cutting in one day. The power is sufficient. It doesn't bog down. I am a petite woman and this chainsaw is comfortable to hold and use. The wight is balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Longer charge than you'd expect!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this baby chain saw because I did not need a high power one and truthfully, I was a little afraid of a full size chain saw. I'm cutting a path through trees that are less than eight years old (6" diameter and less). It works great and the battery lasted longer than I had expected. It has good power, just enough for my needs. My adult son who is an engineer used it too and he was very impressed with the capabilities of this battery operated chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: Lauriloo

customer_reviews.title: 0 Ahr battery and it will really eat up small projects in the yard I was able to cut down a sweet gum tree 8 inches in diameter and around 20 ...
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I would use a battery powered chain saw but wow it has it's place buy a 4.0 Ahr battery and it will really eat up small projects in the yard I was able to cut down a sweet gum tree 8 inches in diameter and around 20 feet high, remove the limbs, cut into 12 inch sections with power remaining. I have not used the original battery.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Light weight!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY a chainsaw that i can maneuver while bending down. Have a bad knee and can't squat - larger chainsaws make me tip over, this one is PERFECT and gets the job done. Battery life lasts about as long i do before i need a break! So happy i got this, i can now do it by myself instead of waiting on husband or son to be home.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Hick

customer_reviews.title: Order issue.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that buying a cordless tool that doesn't come with a battery upset me slightly, but the manual doesn't even reference what model battery fits the damn thing or how I can find one. Of course I went on line and paid for one almost at the cost of the tool and I don't know if it will fit. Crossing my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with what I got
customer_reviews.text: First off this was supposed to come with a battery and a charger it did not second the Oiler does not work on the one i got not happy with the missing battery or the Oiler not working
customer_reviews.author: Joe parsons

customer_reviews.title: ... habitat restoration/ invasive species removal and this chainsaw is awesome. It’s lightweight enough to take on a hike ...
customer_reviews.text: I do habitat restoration/ invasive species removal and this chainsaw is awesome. It’s lightweight enough to take on a hike and is good for about 8-10 8” diameter trees before the battery runs low. I bought a B&D cordless weed eater that came with 2 batteries, so now I have 3 batteries and we are in business. Starting is amazingly easy. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joedy Y

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: This is my first chainsaw and it works well. I've seen that other people have had issues with the manual oil button but mine works ok, it is a little messy though due to the hole in the top. I used vegtable oil cause i did not have or want motor oil and it was fine. I'm a 5'1, 150lb female and it was light enough for me to carry and work with.
customer_reviews.author: Ktyme

customer_reviews.title: NO OIL !!!
customer_reviews.text: The manual oiler on this chainsaw DOES NOT work! I cut dead oak trees about 90% of my cutting. Since the oiler does not work, the chain gets very hot and dulls quickly. I would recommend looking for another product that has a working automatic oiler.
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a gas and corded electric chainsaw, but this is my go to solution for dealing with tree limbs and brush. I have switched out all my outdoor power tools to black and decker and love having the interchangeable batteries. Have not tried it on oak or ash yet, but linden, birch, willow and dogwood are cut pretty easily with this unit and so much quieter than a gas saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jack White

customer_reviews.title: Good workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased the B&D pole chain saw a few weeks earlier and was very impressed with how well it worked so I thought I would give this chain saw a try. Couldn't be happier. Does everything my old gas saw did but much, much lighter and easier to work with. Battery life is great. Between the two saws we were able to cut down about 20 pickup loads of trees and branches from my son's house. Some of the branches were up to 8-10 inches thick and both saws handled them with ease. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: KurtS

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 20V Max Cordless Chainsaw, 10-Inch, Tool Only (LCS1020B)
product_meta.description: Style:20V Chainsaw (Tool Only)The BLACK+DECKER LCS1020B 10-inch 20v MAX Lithium Chainsaw is a bare tool item that operates with a 20v max lithium battery - (bare tool items do not include a battery). This saw offers a 10" premium Oregon low kickback bar & chain that provides smooth and fast cuts. The tool-free blade tension system allows for improved ease of use and quick adjustments and it has a lightweight design for ease of maneuverability and reduced fatigue at only 7.2 Pounds. The wrap around bale handle provides increased control and comfort. And, as an added features, this unit has an improved oiling system with a clear window to gauge oil level. Battery sold separately.
feature_bullets: 10 inches premium Oregon low kickback bar and chain
Tool Free blade tension system for quick adjustments
Oiling system for lubrication of bar and chain
20V MAX Lithium Ion Chainsaw Bare Tool
Included Components: (1) LBXR2020, (1) LCS1620, (1) LCS1020; Power Source: Lithium Ion

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,235 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
